values:
So after 117 weeks without writing anything I decided to get off my arse and do something about it.

Let's see, "recap of the travels of the Smurf for the last 2 years" might be useful...  I broke up with my girlfriend of many years, and changed jobs in quick succession.  I then get a new girlfriend and job quickly thereafter.  I get an offer of my dream job and quit my old job to pursue it.  New girlfriend cheats on me and we break up.  Then I travel along in single land for 2 years, yes entirely single not even going on a date!!!  Dream job goes to hell and is a major drag and I'm not paid nearly enough to deal with the shit.  

So current events include new girlfriend and job hunting so that I can tell the 4% pay increase I was offered (which I believe is insulting) to go away.

Yeah so that's the recap and I promise LJ with the goat as my witness that I will update more often.  Plus I have internet again now and I'm under strict instructions not to get addicted to WOW or I'll be looking for a new girlfriend.

Toodles noodles.
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/37617.html

So hands up all those who had a lesbian threesome today.....

*raises hand and wanders off for more mischief*
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/36429.html

So have been sick the last few days. Anyone who's been around me for an extended period of time will say it's because i'm stressed. Bah.

So anyway the gorgeous Miss Chelle is coming to visit tomorrow. Yay! Drunken debauchery, gluten free food and angry music of the indy punk persuasion. Oh yeah and we have to visit a fetish club while she's here too. :) So much excitement, so bouncy. Hot chick. *drools*

Otherwise not much is happening in the world. Must work over the public hols, but that's okay by me 2.5 times my normal wage makes me happy. Then I can go and play. YAY!

Must be off, I have new icons to fiddle with and reading to do. Will update again later....
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/36141.html

So it's been a while since I last updated. I just want to point out that this is due to the fact that I have been working heaps over Commonwealth Games and school holidays. Thankfully thoough the little shits down here only get 4 days off over Easter, so that will be heaps ace.

I applied for a job the other day. Did my interview, hopefully it went well I should find out in the next few days. I think that I don't want to take it because my boss is super ace and gave me time off to go to the interview. I mean how many bosses would do that?! The boss lady and I had a date last night to talk about everything. It was good. There were ribs with JD sauce. *drools* And bufalo wings. *sigh* So yummy!!

After dinner we did the whole movie thing. Went and saw 'When A Stranger Calls'. It was less crap than I thought it would be, so I was kind of impressed. It was the kind of thing where you go to the movies expecting it to be total arse waste and are then pleasently surprised when it's not as tragic as you thought it would be.

So my plans for today are to go to bass ladies and watch 'She's the Man' or 'V for Vandetta'. It will be heaps fun. I still have to watch the last episode of season 1 Prision Break. I'm totally addicted to that show. There are a heap of new shows out in the states atm that look kinda cool. Must look and see what we could be getting here sometime.

Anyways, must be off. Hope everyone is well. Ciao`.
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/35899.html

So had the day off work today, and of course I have been sick as. Why not?! It's always the way these things work. But hopefully I will feel somewhat better tomorrow. I plan on killing whatever is making me feel unwell by coding a web page because it will entertain me and I haven't done one for a while. It should be fun and keep me out of mischief for the time being at least. Which for the safety of everyone is a good thing.

Pride March happened on Sunday. I missed the parade because of work, but the party was heaps fun. Went to the gardens, watched some of the entertainment, went to the POW and generally enjoyed myself muchly. Would have been great to see the parade because by all accounts it was really good. It was muchly fun to play spot the breeder and peer intently at them until they run away scared. Only did that twice, but I must admit it is a very fun game. :)

Otherwise not much to say really, just thought I should update seeing I have been somewhat interesting this week, compared to my usual 'do nothing but work' self.

Anyways, best be off. Web pages to code. Geek like I must be....
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/35700.html

So it's been a while since I updated. Though because all I have done sinc my last update is work I really don't have much of interest to say.

I am SO tired. not just from school hols and working all the time. I ACTUALLY went out on Saturday night to the POW. It was heaps good until one of the girls had her drink spiked and then I spent 4 + hours in emergency with her. But not only was it shit that she had her drink spiked, but the reason we were out was because it was her farwell from work drinks. Massively shitty. I think the crazy guy who wouldn't piss off spiked the drink. The guy was in a gay pub trying to get the women to chew gum and put it in his hair, because he thought that it would wash out with conditioner... WTF?!?!? So his weird and wouldn't fuck off-ness makes him the drink spiker. So sayeth I!

Anyway not much else is news. Am going to hang out with boss lady tomorrow to watch the end of season 1 and the first few eps of "Supernatural". So that should be fun, so long as she doesn't invite workmates that are pissing me off. Otherwise there may be blood shed. Or at least hair pulling and eye gouging....

Am going to go and visit Miss Chelle soon. Because she said I must. Plus she found some of my mail that went to Armidale instead of Melbourne. A common mistake I'm sure. I mean they're SO similar and the postcodes are like so almost the same!

Anyways, am off to have some lunch and find chaos to create for my own entertainment. Hope everyone is well. Come visit and entertain me all you slackers that haven't come to melbourne yet. Later.
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/35537.html

Friends listen to "Time after time" by Cindy Lauper in the dark together right?!

I have been told they don't.  I think though that I have been mis-informed....
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/35219.html

So it's been a while since I last updated.  Much has happened.  Work Christmas party.  Much fun, alcohol and foolishness.  Took my boss as my date, she even wore a dress for me (apparently!).  She's a great date, we had an ace time.  Laughed far too much to be healthy I'm sure.  :)

Christmas came and went.  It was okay.  Spent the day with boss lady and Kate (workmate), along with boss lay's boy and Jen and Paul (crazy gay man, ex bosses brother).  It was a very work like do, but much fun all the same.  Played the new Trivial Pursuit DVD, had much fun.  I like it.  It has a huge amount of Australian content.  Speaking of which, the actor that plays 'Susan' on Neighbours is a lesbian as everyone knows, but she's also Irish and puts the Aussie accent on for the show and my boss knows her.  I SO want to be introduced!!!   Squee-tastic!  I so am lame!

Anyway, there is nothing excitement planned for New Years.  Am thinking of hanging out with the boss and Kate after we all finish work at eleven.  Watch the firworks and then sleep before I have to start work again on New Years Day at 9.... UGH!

Today is my day off so I am bludging, in amongst doing work. It's quite nice really. Had an argument with the boss over the phone and have been drinking ever since.  Maybe I should stop taking our difference of opinions to heart.  But that smacks of effort because then I'd have to stop giving a shit about her. So whatever.I will figure it out sooner or later..

So yeah not much to report. Got a mad DS for Chrissy.  Am now thinking bout whether I should get a 360 or a PS 3. Any suggestions?!

Anyway I'm getting drunk, so I'm off to stare blankly at a wall. Enjoy your day all.

-The Smurf....
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/34700.html

So I have been quiet for a while. Mostly because there is nothing much to say. I have been working 40+ hours a week over school holidays.

Other than that I have been very quiet catching up on sleep in any spare time I can find. So yes, I am alive. Harry Potter comes out on Saturday. Until I've finished the Half Blood Prince I will be in hiding so that those of you that don't work and will be able to read the book before myself don't ruin it for me. Fucking bludgers!! Aloha.
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/31616.html

So...  Life has been going along swimmingly.  I have a promotion at work and start on Saturday!  I am looking forward to it muchly.  I get to be a team leader, which means not wearing purple, not having to run the rides as often and having an office.  It should be fun.

Had a Uni council meeting via teleconference this morning.  It was about three hours long, but alot was achieved.  Then I got to go to lunch with my immediate boss to have a bit of a chill out and chat.  So the day has been pretty good, but I was ready for a nana nap at about 1 o'clock.  That didn't happen so I'm sure I'll bounce off the walls shortly, so that should be interesting.

I have updated .  So everyone should go and look and educate yourselves.  Just because you can.  So sayeth I.  

I have decided that I sould be able to make up the mixed CD's that they play at Luna all the time, simply because my taste in music is SHIT HOT!  I should go and start building that bridge to get over myself, but meh.  You should all know me well enough to know that it isn't going to happen anytime soon.  Ha, I'm such an amusing bugger.  Which reminds me I hope everyone has bought the "Thirsty Merc" album.  tells me I'm their pimp, so I may as well prove her right for once.  : p  Challenge for all of those reading this - the first person to comment and tell me the title of the song I quoted earlier in this paragraph will recieve $100 courtesy of me the thirsty merc pimp.  (TERMS AND CONDITIONS: 1.All entrants should be Australian citizens. 2. Any entrant found to not support the monarchy in it's current format will be deemed un-Australian and therefore unable to win under clause 1.  3.All entrants should have private health cover, or be deemed bludgers and therefore Australian.  4.All entrants should be paying taxes and therefore have a pen and paper ready to declare possible winnings to the ATO.  5.Wet-left entries will be deemed ineligable because of the environmentally friendly text font they use.  NOTE: The $100 prize will not be honoured on this or any other LJ.  The management appologises for any inconvienence.)

Anywho, that's enough foolishness from me for one day.  Enjoy your week all...  *waves*
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/31342.html

So last week was much fun.  Had my birthday and went to the 'Dale.  Much fun was had on both occasions.  My birthday though is not worth rambling - all that needs to be said is that there was mud cake...  So very chocolate!!

Anyway in the 'Dale I went to the Servies to meet up with Ras and and ended up meeting Beau as well.  So yeah we drank cocktails and then beer and were joined by Chelle.  Then we went to the Newie - it was so funny, so many memories of first year!  So then I spoke to for ages which was fun.  Then saw Jedi, Sam, Justin (crazy as a coconut!) and Sally.  It's really funny being back in a place so small that you know just about everyone.  And they still do that crazy lockout thing- HA!  I actually at one point said "How quaint."  I think I was getting a bit drunk so I was being a bit foolish.

I did however get up and to my meeting by 9am.  No hangover.  I think it's too damn cold in Armidale to get hangovers!  Anyway the meeting was entertaining, mostly because I was sitting between the PVC Research/ Dean of the Sciences and the Dean of Arts and close enough to the Chair of Academic Board to hear what she was saying.  Highly entertaining!

So yes I had a mucho funno time playing with everyone in the 'Dale and it must happen again soon.  Either that or everone should come to Melbourne for Christmas....  You know you want to!!!

Here's a quiz result I got, I thought it would be higher than that - but maybe the test is flawed....

Are You Getting Some?

You have a

80%

chance of getting some.

Go you! Many wish they could be in your shoes (or pants) right about now. You are special my friend. You are almost assured to get some. Now don't screw it up.

Are You Getting Some?

 

Anyways, must be off have to go and get organised to do something for the day.  Take care everyone!  Toodles...
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/31010.html

http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/29611.html

You are a Ninja.
You are like a samurai gone bad. The good side
is no longer interesting you and feel that
darkness is where you belong. Though you may
think you are the evil one, you're not. Because
deep inside there is still that little glimpse
of who you once were. You don't like to
associate with people that much and keep away.
In your mind they are ignorant and not so
interesting anyway. That means you are a lonley
person who don't trust people, and you have
really no desire to do so either. Life is a big
pain and annoyance for you and you aren't quite
sure on how to handle it. Other people see you
as mysterious and secretive, and that is
probably right.

Main weapon: Daggers and throwing
stars
Quote: "I hate people. People make
me pro-nuclear" -Margaret Smith
Facial expression: Frown



What Type of Killer Are You? [cool pictures]
brought to you by Quizilla
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/29332.html

I am getting excited about the up-comming public holiday.  Yes I am working, but my boss is UBER cool and put me on the best shift of the day.  On Monday Luna Park Melbourne is having an all day gig.  Oh, yeah!  And it just so happens that we got "The Living End" headlining.  Super cool!  So everyone may check out the details for Push Over  and be suitably envious (be envious damn you!).

Apart from that I have a heap of shifts and will be busy for the next few days.  Tomorrow I have to go to work for the wet t-shirt competition (aka detailed cleaning of the rides with high pressure hoses).  Should be fun, I'm sure there will be much shenanagans!

Anyways, must be off, have cleaning to do.  Enjoy muffins, hope you are all well.
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/27524.html

WHOOT! Girlbar is on tonight. Bouncyness will be happening all day me thinks. Chelle and myself are talking about going. She isn't keen on the idea, me bouncing off walls. Maybe that was all that coffee though?! Girlbar for those not in the know is a lesbian party (not exclusive, but guys are not there in large numbers) that happens once a month in St Kilda at the Prince of Wales (my pub of choice!). The Prince of Wales is already inhabited by cute girls, but on girlbar nights - SO MUCH cuteness.

Anyway, not much else to say at the mo, so will go and do something productive. Later muffins...
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/26355.html

So yes, haven't updated for a while, so in theory I should have something interesting to write. Don't hold your breath though!

Yes, Chelle is in Melbourne so we are going to play with her for a bit before she heads back to the 'Dale. She is supposed to be looking through microfilm, but she SO wants/needs to go and look at the shinyness that is this wonderful city.

Caught up with Miki P over the weekend. YAY! He is coming to live down here in 3 weeks, so then there will be many more MP parties and trashbagging around South Yarra. He is well, he came to find me at Luna Park and then of course the rumor was that I was switching teams and doing naughty things with the cute guy. You have to laugh. The rumor was made worse when he found me because he yells, "Lover! How the fuck are you?" Ha, ha. Some people need a hobby.

Queer Film Festival launch is tonight. I am told by one of the organisers that it is going to be really good. So I might meander down and see what is happening a bit later in the festival.

Have the weekend off from work because I was supposed to be headed to the 'Dale for a Union board meeting, but my mum is coming to visit. But I am going up there next week anyway for a Uni Council meeting and Strategic Planning session. I am really looking forward to seeing my mum, it'll be fun. She wants to go to Ballarat over the weekend because one of the women she works with told her it was pretty. I think I shall have to enforce my rule of "if the tram doesn't go there, then neither should you!" Although I think I may have to waver on that one a bit or she may decide that I'm a suburb snob.

Anyway I have been up since some sparrow-fart hour this morning. Things are mostly done, but I decided to chill out for 5 - 10 before I crack it completely at something. Lack of sleep is not your friend... I went out to the queerbie pub around the corner last night and then couldn't get away from the girl I met up with until well after 12mn. Sleep, sweet, sweet sleep... real soon precious!

I hear that there's a UNESA meeting this weekend. Should be interesting. The lefties will be up the creek without a paddle this year. The worst part is that, in fucking the Libs with prefferences at election Petie-pie delt himself out of an exec spot. I think he would have been good on exec, but can't do anything about it now I guess.

So yeah that's about everything I think. Should go and shower and get organised. Toodles all....
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/25944.html

You are a Square. What a weirdo.

What kind of Sixties Person are you?
brought to you by Quizilla
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/25821.html

Nemesis

?? Which Of The Greek Gods Are You ??
brought to you by Quizilla
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/24620.html

I'm not entirely sure that being awake this early is a good thing. But then the rest of the week has been shitty and I haven't woken up early. Maybe this is a change in my karma - healthy, good for me even. I am mostly awake because I have the uber flu from this evil Russian woman at the Deaflympic beach volleyball finals. I don't like her.... So now I'm wide awake and not impressed about it.

Work is okay. It still exists to give me a ready supply of cash. The manager that gives everyone the shits is leaving. Still waiting to hear who is getting the Australian Open tickets to the corporate box. I so want them! *drools*

Yes, but not much else is news. Working, sick. Same old. Hope everyone is well. Later, am off to watch some Astroboy and try to feel better.
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/24530.html
Which Family Guy character are you?
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/24144.html

Well New Years has been and gone for another year. I spent the entire night working, but on the up side I did get to meet Jack Black and have a smoko with him, a few staff even had a billy with him. He's such a cool guy, everyone should go see a Tenacious D gig and have a chat with him. I also met a heap of Home and Away people, Killing Heidi, Millsy and heaps more including McLeods Daughters people. So very fun.

Other than that I have been working heaps. Making lots of money so I can pay my tax, Whoot! Anyways, jmitche4's mum has been here staying with us and that has been good.

Hope everyone's 2005 has started well. Will write more after sleep has been had.
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/24002.html

So I have been away from the Squishy for a few days now. It is SO hot here, but it induces weight loss - then I can be a sexy biatch and all will swoon over me. :p Perhaps not, but I am trying to be positive about the heat rather than taking up residence in a bell tower over the whole matter.

Other than the heat and lack of squishy-ness I have been having a blast. The last 2 days I have had morning massages, very tough life I know! Also been on the beach and swimming and playing heaps of pool at my Pops place. Am going for drinks with Evil-bevil to the Sailing Club this afternoon. Should be pretty cool.

The plans for tomorrow currently are to go fishing and try and get some doggie mackrel in the morning and then spending the afternoon lazing around on the beach at Great Kepple Island. Holidays are hella fun, especially when you don't have to go to work. :D

Anyway should go and do something fun like cocktails at the resort by the pool. Enjoy your holidays muffins, and Merry Christmas.

P.S Anyone stuck for something to do on New Years should come to Melbourne. Luna Park is putting on a mad gig Tenacious D, Killing Heidi, etc. Staff get in for free and get major discounts for friends and family.
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/23456.html

Yes, I am currently supposed to be doing some work for my TAFE course. Obviously I am not as I have been fart larking around on the internet. Something new and different!! YAY!!

But I suppose after working for eight very long and hot hours in the sun and riding the rides I am entitled to procrastinate for a few hours... Work with me here people!!!

So here's my latest theory of procrastination: If you take one plastic looking idol contestant and an old Thunderbirds poster and play spot the differences how many in total will there be? Therefore, Anthony Callea is approximately equal to a Thunderbirds character.

Q.E.D (it's Latin, meaning I have proven what I set out to prove!)

That's all...
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/21752.html

Well last night I went out to a gay club, it's not as good as some of the one's I've been to in Brisbane, Sydney or Canberra but it was there and there was much queer-ness. Which was nice after being in The Black Opal (an old straight guy hang out). *shudder*

Not only that, but we're having live coverage of the US Election count. So excited - Yes I am lame enough to get all bouncy over watching election coverage. Not only are we getting the coverage, but Kerry is looking good currently. He's up 77 to 66, for those that don't know the winner will need 270 to be elected, so plenty of counting to go, but it's looking good early. So wanting to see 'The shrub' get beaten, that would make me very happy!

Anyway I must go and watch the counting and be bouncy! GO KERRY, YOU GOOD THING!!! Take care chickens...
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/21140.html

Yes a public holiday, sucked in to those of you not in Victoria. :p My current plans for the day include going to South Melbourne/ Albert Park to find a pub that advertises the best beer in Australia - I plan to sample this product repeatedly and I will let you all know what I thought.

I went to Armidale over the weekend. It's still there, just if anyone was wondering. Not much seems to have changed, which is predictable, but still disappointing.

I must say that Cartman is so funny, I still think he rocks even though it probably isn't fashionable anymore. Go the retro! Speaking of which, Astroboy 11 DVD box set comes out next week. Only $190! Must have it, so shiny!!

Must be off, have a horse to pick for tomorrow. Momma needs her 11 DVD's!!
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/20915.html

Well it is Sunday morning and despite my best efforts at sleeping in the cats and some random small children have thwarted me. Satan is being an evil litte fucker, which is to be expected I suppose, how he shitts me!! Anyone want him, free to anyone who wants to take him away from me, I think I'll go and ask the Chineese resturant if they want him after breakfast.

We have new furniture, YAY! It'll be nice to get rid of all the boxes, including the one's we moved with. So many boxes, so few places to throw them so that they bcome someone elses problem.

In other news I join the ranks of the employed people this week. I got a job here, just for something different. I am not sure how I'll look in purple, probably like an oompa loompa, but such is life I guess. But in cool news Tenacious D are playing there on New Years Eve, so hopefully I'll be working or staff will get tickets to go.

Nothing much else is happening here, just fiddling around and staying out of mischief for a while. I mean isn't a new experience supposed to be good for you?! :p

Anyways, must be off. Take care all...
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/20494.html

Well internet access is go. YAY!! Now I can check my own email and update LJ.

I have decided that Casey Chambers is a dirty mole and should go away. So much skank, such a short woman!

Marty in Aust Idol should be burried somewhere underground. He's SO trying to be the anti-Guy Sebastian. Plus he reminds me too much of someone that annoys the crap out of me.

In less random thoughts, YAY Johnny, John and the coalition! I am very happy with the election result, obviously. I have been mostly well behaved and not gloating too much about it. I love it when you're right and a winner. :)

Not much else has happened, I hear the UNESA council next year looks like the Libs vs the Queers. Should be interesting. I can't be blamed because I didn't even vote, although I will say that I did number the ballot and I put the UNE version of Alexander Downer (read: sniffling, whinggy, private schooled, cling-on (in desperate need of toilet paper), embarrassment) last. It was the least I could do for the SA!

The left will have 12 months to whinge and see what they have left at the end. I have heard of some plans afoot. Should lead to some interesting meetings and protests. But I really don't give a shit anymore, not in Armidale anymore, have other things to occupy myself with.

I have to head back to UNE for a meeting in a week or so. Really not looking forward to it! So much bullshit - so little time! It looks like I will be returning to the hole every 2 or 3 weeks until the end of the year for meetings. I am wondering if I should have left or if I should just quit some of the things I'm involved in?! Time will tell.

Anyway, must be off. Take care muffins!
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/20370.html

I got this email tday and thought I'd share it with everyone:

Dear Kellie,

Congratulations on the result of the Council elections.

I will be writing more formally to you in the next day or so, to welcome you on board. There are a few things coming up really soon, so will be in touch again.

Yours sincerely,

Helen

Helen Arthurson

Head, Office of the Secretariat, and Secretary to Council

University of New England, Armidale NSW 2351

So sweet. Even though Phil is of the opinion that my election is bad for student representation. Phhhtt to that, if students felt they weren't going to be repreented then I wouldn't have been elected. Leftie ferals!

In other news we went and played with a few members of the Union board tonight. They are here on a fact finding mission, so called in to have dinner and a few beers while they were in the neighbourhood. Very fun.

Anyways, must be off to do secret squirel mistchief. Later....
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/20219.html

Well the day has been very uninteresting. Maybe I need to do some more foolish quizes. :)

Lately nothing exciting is really happening. Just working out moving plans. Real soon now! Melbourne here I come!

Anyway I must be off to do some more work. I'm sure there will be more procrastination posts sometime soon!
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/19086.html

I Am A: Lawful Good Halfling Fighter

Lawful Good characters are the epitome of all that is just and good. They believe in order and governments that work for the benefit of all, and generally do not mind doing direct work to further their beliefs.

Halflings are short and fat, like minuature people. (Think 'Hobbits') They enjoy the easy life, but aren't averse to the idea of an adventure from time to time. They get along with all races, and are known for their senses of humor. Halflings also tend to be light of foot, and can move quietly when necessary.

Fighters are the warriors. They use weapons to accomplish their goals. This isn't to say that they aren't intelligent, but that they do, in fact, believe that violence is frequently the answer.

Find out What D&D Character Are You?, courtesy of NeppyMan!
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/18883.html

Why Farmidale is shit - reason #1,968,209: "It's full of diseased people who have no qualms about sharing whatever it is with you!" How I detest flu and illness, damn lefty people at the Carmen Lawrence lecture are to blame. Although Tash was there looking very nice, so it had it's moments. Otherwise illness is amusing, because all elective surgery in Tamworth has been cancelled for a few days, while staff try to get over the gastrointeritis. *giggles* I have no idea why this ammuses me so, but then a bit of insanity is good for everyone.

Otherwise as I said before I went to the EPC lecture. It wasn't too bad although everyone did look to be getting bored about 20 mins into it. WRJM was going to ask her a question about her staff member who committed suicide and whether she had taken responsibility for it yet, but he decided to behave himself. Probably just as well too.

I am using dial-up for a few days, stupid telstra not fixing the lines in NSW yet. So everything is running at a snails pace and I may have to go mental at the cats. Just because everyone knows it's their fault if technology is being difficult. So sayeth I!

Oh, awesome news for the week.... John Anderson is the new patron of the UNE Union!!! WHOOT!!! I think he's majorly awesome and should be Prime Minister - When John Howard resigns I mean! But yes, as with anything there is some unhappy campers around the place, mostly because (A) the situation wasn't properly explained before voting happened; and (B) because people wanted to drink. But yes, very happy camper here!!!

Anyways, must be off before this dial-up connection (How late '90's does that sound?! :p) shits itself....AGAIN!!! Later muffins.
http://smurf-une.livejournal.com/17687.html

Which L Word character will seduce you? by canezbabycanez
User Name
Seduced ByMarina
When?July 17, 2005
How?She got me drunk.
Where?On the kitchen table. We couldn't make it to the bedroom.
Was it hot?Unfuckingbelievable.

That cop guy, Mick Keelty, is such a dumb idiot. He reckons that Australia is more of a terrorist target 'cause of the war with Iraq, 'cause this place called Spain got bombed, or something. Anyone who paid attention during that Tampa thing would know that terrorists always try to get into Australia on illegal boats with boat people, so they can wait for years in detention and then on the off-chance that no one finds out that they're terrorists after looking into their background, there's a slim possibility they'll get into Australia on a TPV. He clearly didn't listen to a thing I said, or he'd know that we decide who comes in to this country and under what circumstances, and I certainly don't remember letting any terrorists in. Our troops are over there to democracise Iraq, but they can't do that while there are still terrorists running around, and geeze is that place chockers with terrorists. As everyone knows, "terrorist" is just a fancy-schmancy way of saying "Muslim", and there's no way we'll have all the Muslims out of there by December. There's a webpage www.johnhoward.blogspot.com It's very amusing and a piss-take of John Howard actually writing in a live journal. After the whole gay marriages thang this is what the PM had to say:

Thursday, August 07, 2003

Homosexuals are so bloody greedy. I mean, they already have a parade, and you'd think that'd be enough, but nooooo, now they want to get married too. They have some lame idea that marriage is about love or something. Idiots. Marriage is about sex. Sex that leads to babies. Babies that lead to Young Libs. Anyway, everyone knows that homosexuality is wrong and dumb and evil. 'Cause homosexual couples adopt kids or have IVF or whatever, and then wreck the kids' lives by raising them in families with same-sex parents. I reckon if a parade is good enough for the ANZACs, then it's good enough for homosexuals. Well, I guess the ANZACs got their own biscuit, too. But then, they were doing good stuff like fighting in a war and that, not threatening the survival of our species. Homosexuals are so gay.

I'm so sick of the ABC. They're so thick that they don't get that when we say "media bias", what we mean is "media bias against us". Dumb stupid idiots. I'm not sure what the letters "ABC" really stand for, but I reckon it must be "Almost Bloody Communists", 'cause the ABC are like, totally in love with the left. Once I said to Kerry O'Brien, "If you love the left so much, why don't you marry the left?" And he goes, "Excuse me?" And I'm like, "Ooh, Kerry and the left, sitting in a tree, k-i-s-s-i-n-g!" And then he told me to get out of his front yard and to stop following him around. Another thing the ABC loves is foreign people. Apparently they even named a show about them called "Foreign Correspondent". Jeeze, why not just name the show "We Love You, Foreigners. Please Come Over Here Illegally In Your Foreign Boats So You Can Take All the Jobs And Collect Welfare"?! And they even have foreigners on some of their programs. Like, there's an Aboriginal chick on Playschool. I dunno about anyone else, but I wouldn't want a foreigner singing "Two Little Dickie Birds" to my kids.

Minority groups suck. posted by Johnny H at 12:03 AM

So what if the PM has said that gays shouldn't be allowed to marry! It's the parties stance! Build your fucking bridge! You can't say you're shocked, I mean the Liberals and Nationals are very right-wing. And as one of their loyal voters it's no shock to me that they have come out and verbalised a party policy. All you queerbies cannot be SO naive as to think that just because the equal age bill went through that all political parties are now going to bow and scrape for the queer vote!! Can you??!!

Perhaps you all need to step back and remove the rainbow coloured glasses and see that no-one cares except you. The fact everyone hates a minority is because minorities believe that they need to be different and stand out. Maybe if you all just got off the soap-box for 5 minutes then you'd realise that if you act like a everyday person and didn't feel the need to grand-stand your gayness, then the gay rights movement wouldn't be SO offensive!

As a lesbian I see nothing offensive about the comments in question. Yes perhaps I would like to get married someday, maybe not. But at this time the religious and political arguments put forward by The Honerable Mr Howard have my vote. And what is 10% of the vote going to matter to anyone, anyway?!

God save the Queen!

I decided when the war started that I was not going to write anything about it in my Live Journal, but this was too amusing not to share with everyone!

Earlier today the American military were doing bombing raids, etc (no not what you're all thinking they "accidently" hit something they own or an ally owns!) and they went without any hitches. So anyway they fly their bomber back to the ship and after the stress of bombing raids going off without a hitch that nothing would go wrong from here. Oh NO! This IS America we're talking about. So anyway they go to land this plane on one of their carriers and successfully land it. All is going well unitl the damn thing taxis off the carrier and into the ocean. Now I have issues with this for a number of reasons, 1) Where was the guy with the ping pong paddles when all this was happening?, and 2) Are the developers of the American planes of the opinion that if it flys fast then it doesn't need brakes?

Anyway those are my amusing thoughts for the night. Enjoy!
